title: Realme P1 Speed's key specs confirmed
description: Realme will launch the P1 Speed on October 15, and the brand has already revealed its design while confirming the smartphone will have the Dimensity 7300 Energy chip at the helm. Now, Realme has revealed more features of the P1 Speed, leaving little to the imagination. For starters, the Realme P1 Speed will feature a 120Hz "OLED Esports Display" and pack a 5,000 mAh battery with 45W charging. It will have 256GB of UFS 3.1 storage onboard with LPDDR4X RAM. Realme hasn't revealed the physical amount of RAM but says the P1 Speed will come with 26GB of "DRAM," which is just virtual...
excerpt: It's launching next week. Realme will launch the P1 Speed on October 15, and the brand has already revealed its design while confirming the smartphone will...
text: Realme will launch the P1 Speed on October 15, and the brand has already revealed its design while confirming the smartphone will have the Dimensity 7300 Energy chip at the helm. Now, Realme has revealed more features of the P1 Speed, leaving little to the imagination. For starters, the Realme P1 Speed will feature a 120Hz "OLED Esports Display" and pack a 5,000 mAh battery with 45W charging. It will have 256GB of UFS 3.1 storage onboard with LPDDR4X RAM. Realme hasn't revealed the physical amount of RAM but says the P1 Speed will come with 26GB of "DRAM," which is just virtual RAM. Moreover, the Realme P1 Speed will come with an IP65 rating, dual speakers, GT Mode, and support for 90FPS gameplay. It will also have a 6,050 mm2 stainless steel VC cooling area. The smartphone's primary camera will use a 50MP sensor, but Realme hasn't divulged anything about the other cameras. Source
html:
Realme will launch the P1 Speed on October 15, and the brand has already revealed its design while confirming the smartphone will have the Dimensity 7300 Energy chip at the helm. Now, Realme has revealed more features of the P1 Speed, leaving little to the imagination.

For starters, the Realme P1 Speed will feature a 120Hz "OLED Esports Display" and pack a 5,000 mAh battery with 45W charging. It will have 256GB of UFS 3.1 storage onboard with LPDDR4X RAM. Realme hasn't revealed the physical amount of RAM but says the P1 Speed will come with 26GB of "DRAM," which is just virtual RAM.

Moreover, the Realme P1 Speed will come with an IP65 rating, dual speakers, GT Mode, and support for 90FPS gameplay. It will also have a 6,050 mm2 stainless steel VC cooling area. The smartphone's primary camera will use a 50MP sensor, but Realme hasn't divulged anything about the other cameras.

Source
